content:
Add a Text Area Input Element to a FlexCard Available beginning Winter '22. You are here: SALESFORCE HELP DOCS OMNISTUDIO From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Text Area element onto the canvas. Configure properties common to all Input elements: (Optional) In Field Binding, bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field. In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element. (Optional) In Placeholder, enter temporary text that displays inside the input field and which suggest to the user what content to enter. (Optional) Check Required if the user must enter or select a value for this input element. (Optional) Check Read-only to disable the ability to modify the input values. (Optional) In Help Text, enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field. In Minimum Length, enter the minimum number of characters the user must enter. In Maximum Length, enter the maximum number of characters the user can enter. (Optional) Select to create new lines of text with the
element. To configure additional properties available to the element, click + Add New in the Custom Attributes section. FlexCards Text Area Input Element Properties Text Area Input element properties are configurable in the Properties panel when you select a Text Area element in the FlexCard Designer. Enable users to enter multiple lines of text. Do not use symbols that can break JSON and cause an Unterminated string in JSON error. In the FlexCards tab, click a version of a FlexCard to open the FlexCard Designer. To execute an action when a user interacts with the input element, click + Add Action.
title: Adding Text Area Input Element to FlexCards
